definition: to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: How ungrateful then that, as the talks limp towards collapse, accusing fingers are being pointed at America.
sentences.chinese: 随着对话走向破裂，大家非常不领情面得指责美国。

sentences.english: It's monstrous that he should be so ungrateful for all the help his friends have given him.
sentences.chinese: 太可怕了，他竟然对朋友们的帮助如此不领情。

sentences.english: After all I had done, she was still ungrateful.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我做了这一切，可她仍然不领情。

sentences.english: It was Johnny's turn to be patronizingly patient.
sentences.chinese: 轮到约翰尼要人领情地耐心了。

sentences.english: I'm afraid I stand off because she will not be grateful.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我不能同意，因为她是不会领情的。

sentences.english: It is a mistake to lavish kindness ungrateful people.
sentences.chinese: 对于不领情的人来说浪费感情是一种错误。

sentences.english: I'm not ungrateful. But I would like to have a baby.
sentences.chinese: 我并非不领情，但是我真的想要一个孩子。

sentences.english: If invited to someone's house for dinner, don't be one of he ungrateful fed.
sentences.chinese: 如果应邀到某人家中赴宴，别吃了还不领情。

sentences.english: It’s the typical face work frequently adopted by Chinese government, yet the foreigners never showed their gratefulness.
sentences.chinese: 这是中国政府典型面子工程，可外国人仍不领情。

sentences.english: More than the water did not appreciate, contemplating the psychological pull head incense.
sentences.chinese: 余得水并不领情，心理盘算着拔香头。

definition: to acknowledge sb as senior or superior (often in negative)/to accept (a version of events)/to buy it
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
to show deference or praise publicly
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
variant of 買帳|买帐[mai3 zhang4]
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
